definition: flower/blossom/CL:朵[duo3],支[zhi1],束[shu4],把[ba3],盆[pen2],簇[cu4]/fancy pattern/florid/to spend (money, time)/(coll.) lecherous/lustful
crowded/framework for silkworms/gather foliage/bunch/classifier for bunched objects

sentences.english: What we see is the blossom, which passes. The rhizome remains.
sentences.chinese: 我们所见到的是将会消逝的花簇，而根茎长驻。

sentences.english: A whorl of bracts subtending a flower or flower cluster.
sentences.chinese: 包被花或花簇的一轮苞片。

sentences.english: Bark brown, flake off Schnabelia branchlet, sprig flower clustered on the top.
sentences.chinese: 树皮褐色，片状剥落小枝四棱，花簇生于小枝顶端。

sentences.english: In full bloom, plum trees are covered with densely packed, showy flower clusters.
sentences.chinese: 花朵盛开时，李树被艳丽的团团花簇所覆盖。

definition: spray (sprig of a plant with blossoms)/cuttlefish (on dining menus)/(literary) beautiful woman
flourishing blossom/a mass of flowers/luxuriant flowers
fig. beautiful purples and brilliant reds (idiom); lit. beautiful flowers
branches and tendrils/fig. overcomplicated or digressive
(of a plant) to be in bud
